name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $identifier
desc: Returns: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by the device or gateway software, manufacturers, other organizations or owners. For example: handle ID.

name: $addidentifier
desc: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by the device or gateway software, manufacturers, other organizations or owners. For example: handle ID.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by the device or gateway software, manufacturers, other organizations or owners. For example: handle ID.

name: $::type
desc: Returns: Describes the type of the metric. For example: Heart Rate, PEEP Setting, etc.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Describes the type of the metric. For example: Heart Rate, PEEP Setting, etc.

name: $unit
desc: Returns: Describes the unit that an observed value determined for this metric will have. For example: Percent, Seconds, etc.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Describes the unit that an observed value determined for this metric will have. For example: Percent, Seconds, etc.

name: $source
desc: Returns: Describes the link to the  Device that this DeviceMetric belongs to and that contains administrative device information such as manufacturer, serial number, etc.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Describes the link to the  Device that this DeviceMetric belongs to and that contains administrative device information such as manufacturer, serial number, etc.

name: $parent
desc: Returns: Describes the link to the  Device that this DeviceMetric belongs to and that provide information about the location of this DeviceMetric in the containment structure of the parent Device. An example would be a Device that represents a Channel. This reference can be used by a client application to distinguish DeviceMetrics that have the same type, but should be interpreted based on their containment location.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Describes the link to the  Device that this DeviceMetric belongs to and that provide information about the location of this DeviceMetric in the containment structure of the parent Device. An example would be a Device that represents a Channel. This refere

name: $operationalStatus
desc: Returns: Indicates current operational state of the device. For example: On, Off, Standby, etc.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Indicates current operational state of the device. For example: On, Off, Standby, etc.

name: $color
desc: Returns: Describes the color representation for the metric. This is often used to aid clinicians to track and identify parameter types by color. In practice, consider a Patient Monitor that has ECG/HR and Pleth for example; the parameters are displayed in different characteristic colors, such as HR-blue, BP-green, and PR and SpO2- magenta.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Describes the color representation for the metric. This is often used to aid clinicians to track and identify parameter types by color. In practice, consider a Patient Monitor that has ECG/HR and Pleth for example; the parameters are displayed in differen

name: $category
desc: Returns: Indicates the category of the observation generation process. A DeviceMetric can be for example a setting, measurement, or calculation.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Indicates the category of the observation generation process. A DeviceMetric can be for example a setting, measurement, or calculation.

name: $measurementPeriod
desc: Returns: Describes the measurement repetition time. This is not necessarily the same as the update period. The measurement repetition time can range from milliseconds up to hours. An example for a measurement repetition time in the range of milliseconds is the sampling rate of an ECG. An example for a measurement repetition time in the range of hours is a NIBP that is triggered automatically every hour. The update period may be different than the measurement repetition time, if the device does not update the published observed value with the same frequency as it was measured.

pvardefs.desc: Describes the measurement repetition time. This is not necessarily the same as the update period. The measurement repetition time can range from milliseconds up to hours. An example for a measurement repetition time in the range of milliseconds is the sam

name: $calibration
desc: Returns: Describes the calibrations that have been performed or that are required to be performed.

name: $addcalibration
desc: Describes the calibrations that have been performed or that are required to be performed.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Describes the calibrations that have been performed or that are required to be performed.
